section.p: This section describes the configuration settings that are written to the bssapp database during deployment.

section.title: APP_BASE_URL
section.p: The URL for accessing the Web interface of APP
<host_fqdn> is the FQDN or IP address of the host to access , 8881 is the port. Omit the port if is operated with its proxy. oscm-app is the context root of APP and cannot be changed.
This setting corresponds to the OSCM_APP_URL setting in the var.env configuration file.

section.title: APP_TIMER_INTERVAL
section.p: The interval (in milliseconds) at which APP polls the status of instances.

section.title: APP_TIMER_REFRESH_SUBSCRIPTIONS
section.p: The interval (in milliseconds) at which APP polls the status of instances and updates the number of virtual machines (VMs) provisioned for subscriptions to IaaS services, for example in OpenStack. The number is updated only in case the technical service definition specifies a VMS_NUMBER parameter.

section.title: APP_TIMER_REFRESH_USAGEDATA
section.p: The interval (in milliseconds) at which APP triggers the execution of a Shell script for collecting events that caused usage costs in the cloud. As prerequisites, a script defining which events are to be collected must exist, the technical service definition must contain the definition of these events, and specify the execution of the usage data script.

section.title: APP_ADMIN_MAIL_ADDRESS
section.p: The email address to which email notifications are sent.

section.title: BSS_USER_KEY
section.p: The key of the user for accessing from APP.

The user specified here must have the administrator role for a technology provider organization in . The user account is used for carrying out actions on behalf of APP in and for registering service controllers.

p.note: To persistently change the key, you need to add the APP_USER_KEY setting to the var.env file.

section.title: BSS_USER_ID
section.p: The identifier of the user specified in BSS_USER_KEY for accessing .
Default: The user specified in the APP_USER_NAME setting in the var.env file at installation time.

p.note: To persistently change the user name, you need to use the APP_USER_NAME setting in the var.env file.

section.title: BSS_USER_PWD
section.p: The password of the user specified in BSS_USER_KEY for accessing .
Default: The password specified in the APP_USER_PWD setting in the var.env file at installation time.

p.note: To persistently change the password, you need to use the APP_USER_PWD setting in the var.env file.
